todaysEvents.title: ZEROBASE Front-End Hack Impacting Users
todaysEvents.description: A ZEROBASE front-end hack resulted in over 270 users losing more than $240K USDT. Following the attack, Binance Wallet has blocked malicious domains and contracts.

todaysEvents.title: Bitcoin Potential Hijack Investigation
todaysEvents.description: There are questions about whether Bitcoin has been hijacked.

todaysEvents.title: Zerobasezk Frontend Compromise and User Fund Theft
todaysEvents.description: Hackers compromised the Zerobasezk frontend, stealing over $240K from more than 270 users, including one user who lost 123,597 $USDT. Users are advised to revoke any suspicious contract approvals in their wallets.

todaysEvents.title: Scam Activity Surge on Litecoin
todaysEvents.description: There are reports of many scammers on Litecoin today.

todaysEvents.title: Nepes Corp Data Breach by Qilin Group
todaysEvents.description: The Qilin hacking group claims to have breached Nepes Corp and exfiltrated 1.5 TB of data. The cyberattack was observed on December 11, 2025.

past7Days.briefing: This week witnessed an intense escalation in cyber threats across sectors, characterized by high-profile ransomware attacks, sophisticated exploits, and widespread fraud targeting financial institutions, DeFi protocols, SaaS vendors, and major corporations. Ransomware and data breaches struck at least three large financial and insurance entities, leading to the compromise of millions of records. The DeFi sector experienced repeated high-value hacks, notably at Yearn Finance and ZEROBASE, highlighting persistent vulnerabilities in smart contract code and frontend infrastructure. Meanwhile, a €700M deepfake crypto scam network was dismantled, but social engineering scams and targeted malware campaigns—leveraging new zero-click vectors and abused ad platforms—remained rampant, particularly against cryptocurrency and AI users. The emergence of new exploits targeting authentication, AI platforms, and cloud services (e.g., Microsoft Azure) signals a rapidly evolving threat landscape.
past7Days.trends:
Several clear trends emerged this week: 
- Ransomware and data breaches are increasingly exploiting third-party and software vulnerabilities, with the financial and insurance sectors being prime targets.
- DeFi and crypto platforms remain under sustained attack, both via smart contract vulnerabilities and user-facing phishing/scam campaigns. Multiple hacks and a surge in scams on platforms like Telegram and Litecoin were reported.
- Attackers are leveraging novel vectors, including zero-click spyware (Predator, GeminiJack), ad-based infostealer campaigns (AMOS), and sophisticated social engineering (deepfake scams, hijacked WeChat accounts).
- Cloud and SaaS platforms (Microsoft Azure, Gladinet) are facing targeted exploits, with attackers exploiting authentication flows and cryptographic flaws.
- The daily threat score remained persistently high, with most days seeing multiple high-severity incidents, indicating a sustained period of elevated cyber risk.
past7Days.predictions: In the coming days, organizations should expect continued high risk—especially in financial, crypto, and SaaS sectors. Ransomware and large-scale data breaches are likely to persist, with attackers exploiting unpatched vulnerabilities and targeting third-party providers. DeFi protocols and crypto wallets will remain in attackers' crosshairs, as smart contract bugs and frontend weaknesses offer lucrative targets. Social engineering, deepfake scams, and phishing on messaging platforms (Telegram, WeChat) are expected to intensify, driven by the holiday season and ongoing volatility in digital asset markets. Cloud service and AI platform exploits (e.g., Gemini AI, Azure) may proliferate as attackers weaponize newly discovered zero-click and consent-based vulnerabilities. Confidence level: High—these patterns are reinforced by ongoing global cybercrime trends and the volume/severity of recent incidents. Urgent focus on vulnerability management, user education, and layered incident response is recommended.
